info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 15 at 2:34PM MDT until August 15 at 4:30PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 545 PM MDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of northwest Colorado and west central Colorado, including the following counties, in northwest Colorado, Garfield. In west central Colorado, Mesa. * WHEN...Until 545 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Rises in small streams and normally dry arroyos. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 232 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause small stream flooding. Between 0.7 and 1.1 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Roan Creek, Middle Fork Parachute Creek, Dry Fork Roan Creek, Parachute Creek, East Fork Parachute Creek, Conn Creek, East Fork Conn Creek and Alkali Creek. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Parachute, De Beque and Battlement Mesa.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
